content:
You're already on the right track with meditation and reading before bed, but doing it in bed might be making it harder for you to wind down and fall asleep. By moving your pre-sleep routine to a different room or area, you'll be creating a clear distinction between your "awake time" and "sleep time." This can help your brain associate your bed with sleep and relaxation, making it easier to fall asleep and improve the quality of your sleep.

Remember to make your new pre-sleep routine area cozy and comfortable, with a comfortable chair or couch, dim lighting, and a calm atmosphere. You can even add some plants, aromatherapy, or calming decor to enhance the relaxing ambiance.

By making this small change, you'll be able to:

* Create a clear separation between awake and sleep time
* Associate your bed with sleep and relaxation
* Improve the quality of your sleep

Keep in mind that it might take some time for your brain to adjust to this new routine, so be patient and consistent. Stick to your new pre-sleep routine and see how it affects your sleep quality over the next few days.

If you need any more guidance or have any other questions, feel free to ask!
